Fantasy 











 





Changing of the guard?
 




Is this the year Steve Nash's Suns take the West?  (Getty Images)



    

    

      Whoever wins the Spurs-Suns series 
      will take the title, right? Tony Mejia won't go there, but it is 
      the most anticipated matchup. In the 
      East, Big Ben leads the Bulls vs. the Pistons as the 
      conference semis tip off on Saturday.
    

  
 Related Links:• Spurs-Suns: Series starts Sunday | Bulls-Pistons: Deng vs. Prince key• Jazz, Rockets going to 7 | UTA-HOU | Playoffs: Bracket | Picks | Awards


 


 

 





 Derby time: It's any horse's race in Run for the Roses


    

      
      There's a full field of 20, all 
      sorts of history that could be made and even weather as a 
      possible factor. It all adds up to a wide-open Kentucky Derby at 6:04 ET 
      on Saturday.
    

  
• Field, odds | History: Triple Crown | Derby | Notes


 

 





 Pistone: NASCAR brings the future back to Richmond


    

      
      With every 
      race, the Car of Tomorrow cements itself into NASCAR. While some drivers 
      are nervous, the COT is what the sport needs after some recent bad 
      publicity.
    

  
• Zombie wins pole | Grid | Busch: Bowyer takes win
